_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility: Fornoff Fertilizer Service, Inc.

Contact: Dru Bergman

Phone: (309) 538-4211



1. Facility Policy.

    The Owners, Management, and its employees are commited to the prevention of any accidental releases of Ammonia ( Anhydrous). If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Mason County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.



2. Facility Information.

    The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers. Anhydrous Ammonia is recieved, stored, and distributed for the direct application as a nutrient for crop production. The maximum quantity stored at this facility would be 501300.0 pounds in storage tanks and nurse tanks.



3. Worst-Case Scenario and Alternate Release Scenario.

     Have scenario in program.



4. Accidental Release Prevention Program.

    The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupation Safety and Health Adminisration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, " Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and the State of Illinois, Fertilizer Law, Subpart A, Anhydrous Ammonia. The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Regisration Form, see section 8.3 (b).



5. Five-Year Accident History.

    There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or enviromental damage.



6. Emergency Action Plan.

    The facility has:

A. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;



B. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



C. If a large rele

ase of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response actions is to start evacuation of the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers;

      C1. With-in 15 minutes of determining that the amount of the release would be over 100 pounds, the Emergency Coordinator will notify: The National Emergency Response Center at (800)-424-8802

      C2. Immediately ( with-in one hour) after determining that the amount of the release would be over 100 pounds, the Emergency Coordinator will notify the, Illinois Enviromental Management Agency at (800) 782-7860 in-state or (217) 782-7860 out-of state.



7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

   Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of the facility. There are no addition specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
